Class BuildGameModel

java.lang.Object
BuildGameModel
class BuildGameModel
extends java.lang.Object
BuildGameModel holds data regarding the game state. BuildGameController uses BuildGameModel's accessors and mutators to access this data. This class does not interact with BuildGameView.
Author:
Larry Chiem, Ian Rowe, Raymond Shum, Nicholas Stankovich

  • Constructor Details

    • BuildGameModel

      BuildGameModel​(int numPacks, int numJokersPerPack, int numUnusedCardsPerPack, Card[] unusedCardsPerPack, int numPlayers, int numCardsPerHand)
      Constructor. Initializes instance variables and creates a new game using CardGameFramework.
      Parameters:
      numPacks - int representing packs of cards used
      numJokersPerPack - int representing Jokers in each pack
      numUnusedCardsPerPack - int representing number of unused cards
      unusedCardsPerPack - int[] holding unused cards if they exist
      numPlayers - int representing number of players in the game
      numCardsPerHand - int representing number cards in each players hand

  • Method Details

    • initializeGame

      private void initializeGame​(int numPacks, int numJokersPerPack, int numUnusedCardsPerPack, Card[] unusedCardsPerPack, int numPlayers, int numCardsPerHand)
      Private member function. Merged from CardGameFramework, used to assist in starting a new game.
      Parameters:
      numPacks - int representing packs of cards used
      numJokersPerPack - int representing Jokers in each pack
      numUnusedCardsPerPack - int representing number of unused cards
      unusedCardsPerPack - int[] holding unused cards if they exist
      numPlayers - int representing number of players in the game
      numCardsPerHand - int representing number cards in each players hand

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Used to initialize a game by dealing cards to the player and computer, then sorting their hands.

    • deckDealsToStacks

      public boolean deckDealsToStacks()
      Deals a card to the top of each stack if enough cards are left in deck.
      Returns:
      TRUE if cards are dealt and FALSE if they cannot be dealt

    • playerPlaysToStack

      public boolean playerPlaysToStack​(int cardIndex, int stackIndex)
      Plays a card from the player's hand to the top of one of the stacks. The boolean represents whether the player's hand can be refilled. False means that the deck is empty and the game should be ended. This method does not end the game.
      Parameters:
      cardIndex - int representing index of player card in array
      stackIndex - int representing index of stack in hand array
      Returns:
      TRUE if can deal card to player, FALSE if not

    • computerPlaysToStack

      public boolean computerPlaysToStack​(int cardIndex, int stackIndex)
      Plays a card from the computer's hand to the top of one of the stacks. The boolean represents whether the computer's hand can be refilled. False means that the deck is empty and the game should be ended. This method does not end the game.
      Parameters:
      cardIndex - int representing index of computer card in array
      stackIndex - int representing index of stack in hand array
      Returns:
      TRUE if can deal card to computer, FALSE if not

    • getPlayerIcons

      public javax.swing.Icon[] getPlayerIcons()
      Returns an array of Icon objects in the order of the cards in the player's hand.
      Returns:
      icon[] representing the player's hand

      public javax.swing.Icon[] getStackIcons()

      Returns:

    • getNumCardsPerHand

      public int getNumCardsPerHand()
      Returns number of cards in an individual hand. Both hands are same size (game ends if not) so computer hand is an arbitrary reference.
      Returns:
      int representing number of cards in an individual's hand

      Returns:
      int representing number of skips made by the player.

    • increasePlayerSkips

      public boolean increasePlayerSkips()
      Increases the playerSkipCounter by one.
      Returns:
      TRUE if maximum skip count has not been reached.

    • getComputerSkips

      public int getComputerSkips()

      Returns:
      int representing number of skips made by the computer.

      Increases the computerSkipCounter by one.
      Returns:
      TRUE if maximum skip count has not been reached.

      Returns:

    • deal

      public boolean deal()
      Deals cards to all player hands until full or until no cards remain.
      Returns:
      TRUE if cards are dealt until hands are full and FALSE if deck empties

    • sortHands

      void sortHands()
      Sorts hands in ascending order of value from bottom to top of array.

    • playCard

      Card playCard​(int playerIndex, int cardIndex)
      Hand at playerIndex plays (and removes) Card at cardIndex on its array.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - int representing index on array of hands
      cardIndex - int representing index on array of cards in Hand object
      Returns:
      Card object representing card played from hand (or invalid card)

    • takeCard

      boolean takeCard​(int playerIndex)
      Hand object at playerIndex in Hand array takes a card from the deck. The deck removes its top card.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex -
      Returns:

    • turnIntIntoCardValue

      static java.lang.String turnIntIntoCardValue​(int k)
      Return character (as string) at position k in the valuRanks array. From 0-13.
      Parameters:
      k - position of value in valuRanks array
      Returns:
      String of character in k position of valuRanks array

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      String of first letter of capitalized suit name
